results.firPara: For Leicester City the Champions League anthem seems to have the effect of smelling salts. Two thrashings in the Premier League have been followed by victories in Europes premier club competition and, in the wake of the drubbing at Chelsea on Saturday, the challenge for Claudio Ranieris players is to clear their heads once again and repeat the trick for a third time.
results.secPara: FC Copenhagen are Leicesters opponents at the King Power Stadium on Tuesday night in a game that cannot come quickly enough for the English champions on the back of another chastening defeat. They have lost all four Premier League fixtures on the road this season, conceding 13 goals in the process, and it would have been interesting to be a fly on the wall when the players got their heads together for a meeting on Sunday.
results.webTitle: Leicester City hoping for another restorative Champions League night

results.firPara: Campaigners fear harsh treatment of complainant will deter victims from coming forward as conviction rate drops
results.secPara: The lead police officer on sex crimes for England and Wales sought to reassure victims they would be treated sensitively and seriously in the wake of the outcry over Ched Evans rape acquittal.
results.webTitle: Police try to reassure sexual assault victims after Ched Evans verdict

results.firPara: The Football Association chairman, Greg Clarke, has suggested it may be too soon for the highly rated Bournemouth manager Eddie Howe to be thrown into the furnace of the England job.
results.secPara: Appearing before a parliamentary select committee, Clarke reiterated that the interim manager, Gareth Southgate, had two more matches in which to stake his claim for the full-time job in the wake of the premature departure of Sam Allardyce following just one game in charge.
results.webTitle: Eddie Howe a fine leader but it may be too soon for England, says FA’s Clarke

results.firPara: • Parliamentary committee says governing bodys oversight astonishing
results.secPara: • Parliamentary committee says governing bodys oversight astonishing
results.webTitle: FA accused of ‘institutional failure’ over Sam Allardyce England appointment

results.firPara: Slowly but surely, Germanys friendliest town is getting back on to the map again, helped by a super-hot striker and a hard-working, tactically astute team
results.secPara: Slowly but surely, Germanys friendliest town is getting back on to the map again, helped by a super-hot striker and a hard-working, tactically astute team
results.webTitle: Anthony Modeste making the most of Cologne's Bundesliga ascent | Raphael Honigstein

results.firPara: Jorge Sampaolis side recorded their first away win for 511 days at Leganés last weekend but while there are signs of progress, theres much work to do
results.secPara: Jorge Sampaolis side recorded their first away win for 511 days at Leganés last weekend but while there are signs of progress, theres much work to do
results.webTitle: Sevilla get the monkey off their back at last but still seek to find their groove | Sid Lowe

results.webTitle: The Fiver | A foot tantalisingly close to his cakehole

results.firPara: Didier Drogba refused to play for Montreal Impact in their 2-2 draw with Toronto FC because he didnt appreciate being named as a substitute, coach Mauro Biello confirmed after the game.
results.secPara: Didier wasnt selected to start the game, Biello said. I spoke with him yesterday he didnt accept the fact to come off the bench and, in the end, he did not want to be in the 18.
results.webTitle: Didier Drogba refused to play after being left out of starting XI, Montreal confirm

results.firPara: Neymar will this week sign a five-year contract with Barcelona that will keep the Brazil forward at the Camp Nou until 2021.
results.secPara: Barcelona have announced that the 24-year-old will sign his new deal on Friday.
results.webTitle: Neymar set to sign new five-year Barcelona deal up to 2021

results.firPara: Son Heung-min is remembered at Bayer Leverkusen as an authentic global star; a player who scored important goals and fired Champions League qualifications and one who brought additional clout on the commercial front. Unfortunately for Son, who returns to his former club with Tottenham Hotspur in the Champions League on Tuesday night, the manner of his departure remains fresh in the memory, too.
results.secPara: Son began last season as a Leverkusen player, having started in the Bundesliga opener at home to Hoffenheim and the first leg of the Champions League play off away against Lazio. Then Tottenham ramped up their interest and, on the day before the return against Lazio, there was no sign of Son at Bayers open training session.
results.webTitle: Son Heung-min became a global brand at Leverkusen but still faces difficult return | David Hytner
